ACCEPTABLE ITEMS

We recommend that you bring a shade-hat, sunglasses, and sunscreen for daytime, and a warm jacket for the evening. Please bring all necessary items with you.

  • YES You can have fun
  • YES You can dance
  • YES You can smile
  • YES You can bring Prescription Medications if accompanied by a script from your doctor with the name matching your ID. In addition you can only bring them in original bottle with the name matching your ID and only the dose for that day.
  • YES Cell Phones
  • YES Sunglasses
  • YES Hats
  • YES Glowsticks
  • YES Glowing/Illuminated Costumes or Jewelry
  • YES Flags/Banners or Handmade Signs

PROHIBITED ITEMS

For your comfort and safety and the comfort and safety of others we request that you do not bring:

  • NO Illegal Substances
  • NO Marijuana
  • NO E-cigs
  • NO Animals (except service animals)
  • NO Drugs or Drug Paraphernalia
  • NO Narcotic Medical will be allowed
  • NO Alcohol
  • NO Laser Pointers
  • NO Stickers, Flyers
  • NO Firearms, Knives or Weapons (any sharp objects)
  • NO Unauthorized/Unlicensed Vendors Allowed
  • NO Unauthorized Solicitations, Handbills, Sampling, Give-Aways, etc.

Rules are subject to change without notice.

Please understand that any and all rules for VYC5 have been instituted with the safety of all of our guests in mind. These rules have been collectively agreed upon by Law Enforcement/Security/Venue Staff/Vietnamese Youth Convention Staff to ensure a safe and enjoyable time is afforded to all attendees. We understand that you might not get why certain things are and are not permitted, but we can assure you that all rules are in the best interest of all who are attending!

Noise Level in Resident Halls

Participants are expected to realize that in a community setting, and especially in an academic environment, consideration and courtesy for others is a most important factor at all times. While it is a fact that some amount of noise is bound to occur, participants who continually infringe on the rights of others by maintaining unacceptable noise levels will be subject to disciplinary action. participants are expected to comply with all designated quiet hours. Residence hall quiet hours are minimally established from:

12:00am to 10:00am Friday and Saturday.

10:00pm to 8:00am Sunday

These hours may be extended by the individual hall communities.

Safety & Medical

VYC is dedicated to providing a safe environment for the participants, the staff, the speakers, and everyone else who helps make this event a reality. Public and private security and professional medical staff will be present throughout the entire event. If you need any assistance please look for Medical and Information tent(s), or seek out a peace officer or event staff member.

ZERO TOLERANCE FOR DRUG USE OR POSSESSION

The use or possession of any illegal drugs will not be tolerated anywhere inside or outside the venue. Do not bring any illegal substances to the VYC event as violators will be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law. If you are found intoxicated at the door, security will not allow you to enter the venue. VYC staff reserves the right to refuse entry to anyone. Please come with a smile and be prepared to enjoy the full experience of VYC.
